results.title: Napoleon: the end of a dictator
results.creator_credit: International Film Associates, Learning Corporation of America and Victor Vicas
results.brief_description: Explores the causes of the downfall of Napoleon, including the weariness caused by war, tyranny in France and the new nationalism throughout Europe.

results.title: Napoleon Bonaparte and the Battle of Austerlitz
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Napoleon remains one of the most enigmatic and skillful military leaders the world has ever seen. Exploiting the turmoil of the French Revolution, Napoleon was able to eventually become Emperor of France and then set his sights towards the rest of Europe. At the Battle of Austerlitz, Napoleon was able to command a victory against Austria and Russia.

results.title: Napoleon (2000) [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Grubin Productions and David Grubin
results.brief_description: Details the life and times of an intriguing historical figure, Napoleon Bonaparte, his rise to military power and highs and lows of a colourful life at a time of great social upheaval in Europe. Episode 1. “To destiny” - Recounts the story of Napoleon’s extraordinary rise from the obscurity of his Corsican childhood to famous victories in Italy. Also tells of his love for Josephine Beauharnais. Episode 2. “Mastering luck” - Charts Napoleon’s ascent to absolute power from victorious General to first Consol to Emperor of France. Episode 3. “The Summit of ambition” - Traces Napoleon’s conquest of most of Europe including the Battle of Austerlitz and an ambitious invasion of Spain. Episode 4. “The End” - Describes Napoleon’s downfall, including the invasion and subsequent retreat from Russia, his time in exile and his defeat at Waterloo. Fascinating work features historical documentation, stills and re-enactments, as well as interviews with contemporary scholars. Narrated by David McCullough. In English and French with occasional English subtitles.

results.title: Napoleon (1994) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Herald Ace, Film Australia, Michael Bourchier and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: This live action Australian adventure follows an adorable pup on a cross-country search for the dingoes who comprise his doggy roots. Though the cocky young puppy’s real name is Muffin, he prefers to think of himself as Napoleon, a conquering warrior. Napoleon gets more than he bargained for when he is carried aloft in a makeshift air balloon into unknown territory. Embarking on a journey that will turn any pup into a warrior, he dares to go where no pup has gone before; discovering unknown lands and meeting some real friends along the way. [VHS 309191]

results.title: Napoleon
results.creator_credit: Societe Generale Des Films, Films Historiques and Abel Gance
results.brief_description: This epic historical bio-pic, filmed in 1925, was planned as one of several portraying the life of French war hero Napoleon Bonaparte. This instalment, the only one made, traces the story of Napoleon’s school days, his flight from Corsica, through the French Revolution and the Terror, his romance with Josephine, culminating in his triumphant invasion of Italy in 1797. Gance’s initial version (reputedly five hours plus) was severely edited and numerous versions were released over the years, none of which were attuned to Gance’s vision; this version, a painstaking restoration, comes closest. What has excited film buffs about this film is Gance’s revolutionary use of film techniques - colour tinting, swish pans, handheld shots, lengthy double exposures, and split screens culminating in a twenty-minute triptych sequence, which alternates widescreen panoramas with complex multiple-image montages projected simultaneously on three screens. The film, which is overwhelmingly patriotic, has grandeur worthy of D.W. Griffith; the cast are in the thousands and the set pieces are enormous; the panoramic shots, in particular those projected by three separate reels are stunning. However the score, by Francis Ford Coppola’s father Carmine, is militaristic and fairly insipid, and may grate on some viewers. With English intertitles.

results.title: Napoleon
results.brief_description: Acclaimed as the most accurate depiction of the life and times of Napoleon this film depicts the early beginnings, the famed love saga with Josephine, and the undisputable achievements of history’s most colourful conqueror. Filmed on location at the actual historical sites of Versailles, Fountainbleau and the Chateau of Malmaison. The star-studded cast features Orson Welles and Yves Montand.

results.title: Nanook of the North [Sound Version]
results.creator_credit: Pathe Exchange, Films Incorporated and Robert Joseph Flaherty
results.brief_description: Robert Flaherty was commissioned by the Revillon Fur Company to make an advertising film, and the result of his visit to the Hudson Bay territory of Canada was “Nanook of the North”. It is difficult to realise that Flaherty had to work entirely alone and without the advantages of panchromatic stock. His use of realist material to present not a story but rather a dramatic theme of man’s struggle with his environment opened up a new realm of film-making. It was the first documentary film in the modern sense. The film shows Nanook, the Eskimo hunter, preparing with his family for the summer, his meeting with the white trader, catching walruses, seals and foxes, building an igloo, training his children in the arts of hunting, breaking camp, and finally returning through a wild storm to safety and rest in an old igloo. This version has an added musical score. Music by Stanley Silverman.

results.title: Nangiloc-Colignan Community Tackles Salinity
results.creator_credit: Sunraysia Horticultural Centre and Dept of Ag and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: The Nangiloc - Colignan communtiy are working together to tackle the problem of increased salinity in the soil in the Sunraysia district. Farming and irrigation go hand in hand, and with community effort, the aim is to make sure that farming practices enrich rather tahn deplete a vital resource.
